description: From Middle English forsweren, from Old English forswerian (“to swear falsely”). Cognate with Old Saxon farswerian, Old High German farsweren, German verschwören. More at for- +‎ swear.

verbs.description: forswear (third-person singular simple present forswears, present participle forswearing, simple past forswore, past participle forsworn)

entries.meaning: (transitive) To renounce or deny something, especially under oath.
examples: We forswear allegiance and support for the Economic Freedom Fighters.

entries.meaning: (intransitive or reflexive) To commit perjury; to break an oath.
